comments: a(n) is the number of ways in which a deck with n - 1 matched pairs and two singleton cards may be dealt into n hands of two cards, assuming the order of the hands and the order of the cards in each hand is irrelevant.  (See Art of Problem Solving link for proof.) - _Joel B. Lewis_, Sep 30 2012
references: P. A. MacMahon, Combinations derived from m identical sets of n different letters and their connexion with general magic squares, Proc. London Math. Soc., 17 (1917), 25-41.
N. J. A. Sloane, A Handbook of Integer Sequences, Academic Press, 1973 (includes this sequence).
N. J. A. Sloane and Simon Plouffe, The Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences, Academic Press, 1995 (includes this sequence).
